alert.note: Alert for Kingman; Reno (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 26 at 8:23PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Reno and Kingman Counties through 900 PM CST... At 823 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Abbyville to Nashville. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hutchinson, Kingman, South Hutchinson, Haven, Pretty Prairie, Norwich, Arlington, Partridge, Abbyville, Nashville, Yoder, Murdock, Waterloo, Willowdale, Zenda, Spivey, Langdon, Cleveland, Penalosa and Cheney Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for south central Kansas.
